body:
Facebook, Inc. (FB) ended last trading session with a change of 0.34 percent. It trades at an average volume of 22.81M shares versus 15.14M shares recorded at the end of last trading session. The share price of $129.37 is at a distance of 37.29 percent from its 52-week low and down -3.09 percent versus its peak. The company has a market cap of $374.36B and currently has 2.89B shares outstanding. The share price is currently 5.6 percent versus its SMA20, 7.47 percent versus its SMA50, and 6.75 percent versus its SMA200. The stock has a weekly performance of 1.17 percent and is 12.45 percent year-to-date as of the recent close.

On Jan. 3, 2017 Facebook, Inc. (FB) announced that the company’s fourth quarter and full year 2016 financial results will be released after market close on Wednesday, February 1, 2017.

Facebook will host a conference call to discuss its results at 2 p.m. PT / 5 p.m. ET the same day. The live webcast of the call can be accessed at the Facebook Investor Relations website at investor.fb.com, along with the company’s earnings press release, financial tables, and slide presentation.

Twitter, Inc. (TWTR) recently recorded -0.54 percent change and currently at $16.52 is 20.32 percent away from its 52-week low and down -34.57 percent versus its peak. It has a past 5-day performance of -2.59 percent and trades at an average volume of 18.81M shares. The stock has a 1-month performance of -3.28 percent and is 1.35 percent year-to-date as of the recent close. There were about 723.96M shares outstanding which made its market cap $11.96B. The share price is currently -1.96 percent versus its SMA20, -7.67 percent versus its SMA50, and -5.95 percent versus its SMA200.

Jan. 23, 2017 — dick clark productions (dcp) and Twitter, Inc. (TWTR) announced they will again partner to live stream programming from upcoming award shows exclusively on Twitter. The programming, produced by dick clark productions and dcp partners, will be available globally for logged-in and logged-out audiences on Twitter and connected devices.

The programming will kick off with the official two-hour red carpet pre-show for the 52nd Academy of Country Music Awards on April 2nd, produced by the Academy of Country Music and dcp. Subsequent red carpet pre-shows will be exclusively live streamed for the Billboard Music Awards on May 21st and the American Music Awards in November. Twitter will also live stream the 7th Annual Streamy Awards in partnership with dcp and Tubefilter, which will air in the fall of 2017.
title: Active Tech Stock News: Facebook, Inc. (FB), Twitter, Inc. (TWTR) | The Independent Republic
